title: Jon Batchelor-VA-Armed-Robbery-Tammany-Hall.mp3
description:
John Batchelor April 28, 2016

Resigned to Trump. Tammany Hall. National Parks Disrepair. VA Armed Robbery. @marykissel. Ed Hayes. Terry Anderson, @shawn_regan. @frosedc

â€œYou might not have realized it, but National Park Week just wrapped up. President Obama, in an official proclamation, had invited Americans to â€œembrace the opportunity to participate in a variety of scientific, artistic, and athletic activities in our National Parks.â€ Unfortunately, those who did might have been disappointed. After decades of neglect, the Park Service has reported a backlog of $12 billion in deferred maintenance projects, and it shows.
 
http://www.wsj.com/articles/national-parks-lost-in-the-wilds-of-neglect-1461531553

____________

â€œArizona parks and monuments had more than $580 million in deferred maintenance at the end of fiscal 2015, part of a national backlog totaling $11.9 billion, according to a new National Park Service report.

The report said the backlog was up at both the state and national level â€“ from $517 million and $11.4 billion, respectively â€“ at a time when parks are seeing increased numbers of visitors.

â€œNational parks are some of the most majestic, awe-inspiring, historically significant places in the world,â€ said Theresa Pierno, president and CEO of the National Parks Conservation Association, in a statement on the report.

â€œYet Congress has underfunded the National Park Service for years, forcing cutbacks in staffing, maintenance, educational programs, and other visitor services, taking a toll on these iconic and irreplaceable natural and historic resources,â€ her statement said. â€œWe need to give these places the attention they deserve â€“ and the resources in the federal budget often fall short.â€

â€œIn Arizona, the Grand Canyon National Park alone needed an estimated $371.6 million in deferred maintenance last year for what the park service deems â€œnecessaryâ€ work that has not been completed on time. It was one of 22 Arizona sites deemed in need of maintenance fundingâ€¦.â€
 
http://www.tucsonsentinel.com/local/report/020916_parks_budget/national-parks-need-119-billion-maintenance-580m-arizona/

The John Batchelor Show
